newsitem.title: USA: Oppenheimer to stop processing trades for firm - WSJ.
newsitem.headline: Oppenheimer to stop processing trades for firm - WSJ.

text.p: Oppenheimer & Co plans to stop processing trades for a brokerage firm client that has been accused of charging clients excessive commissions, the Wall Street Journal said.
In Tuesday's electronic edition, the Journal said the move is the first fall-out from heightened regulatory scrutiny of Wall Street's so-called clearing business.

It also comes as the New York Stock Exchange considers investigating Oppenheimer's role in processing trades for its client, the brokerage firm of L.T. Lawrence & Co, unnamed sources told the Journal.
Oppenheimer processed trades for L.T. Lawrence, which has been accused of improper telemarketing practices and levying excessive commissions.
Oppenheimer declined to comment. Lawrence Principato, chairman of L.T. Lawrence, said the firm "is solicited on a daily basis" by other clearing firms, but "is in good standing with Oppenheimer."
